snippet: The early departure of Eric Cantor, the Virginia Republican, could allow his successor to participate in the lame-duck session of Congress this fall.
abstract: Republican Rep Eric Cantor of Virginia, who lost June Republican primary to Tea Party-backed conservative David Brat, announces he will resign his seat effective Aug, 18; he will ask Gov Terry McAuliffe to call special election for seat on Nov 4, allowing winner to take seat immediately rather than wait for January 2015; move would allow his successor to participate in lame-duck session after November elections.
lead_paragraph: The early departure of Eric Cantor, the Virginia Republican, could allow his successor to participate in the lame-duck session of Congress this fall.

headline.main: Cantor, Ex-Majority Leader, Is Planning Early Exit From House
headline.print_headline: Ex-Leader Is Planning Early Exit From House
